speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: SCENE IV. Rome. Philario's house.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Enter PHILARIO, IACHIMO, a Frenchman, a Dutchman, and a Spaniard

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Believe it, sir, I have seen him in Britain: he was

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: then of a crescent note, expected to prove so worthy

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: as since he hath been allowed the name of; but I

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: could then have looked on him without the help of

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: admiration, though the catalogue of his endowments

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: had been tabled by his side and I to peruse him by items.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: You speak of him when he was less furnished than now

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: he is with that which makes him both without and within.

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: I have seen him in France: we had very many there

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: could behold the sun with as firm eyes as he.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: This matter of marrying his king's daughter, wherein

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: he must be weighed rather by her value than his own,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: words him, I doubt not, a great deal from the matter.

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: And then his banishment.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Ay, and the approbation of those that weep this

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: lamentable divorce under her colours are wonderfully

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: to extend him; be it but to fortify her judgment,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: which else an easy battery might lay flat, for

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: taking a beggar without less quality. But how comes

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: it he is to sojourn with you? How creeps

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: acquaintance?

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: His father and I were soldiers together; to whom I

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: have been often bound for no less than my life.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Here comes the Briton: let him be so entertained

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: amongst you as suits, with gentlemen of your

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: knowing, to a stranger of his quality.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Enter POSTHUMUS LEONATUS

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: I beseech you all, be better known to this

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: gentleman; whom I commend to you as a noble friend

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: of mine: how worthy he is I will leave to appear

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: hereafter, rather than story him in his own hearing.

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: Sir, we have known together in Orleans.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Since when I have been debtor to you for courtesies,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: which I will be ever to pay and yet pay still.

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: Sir, you o'er-rate my poor kindness: I was glad I

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: did atone my countryman and you; it had been pity

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: you should have been put together with so mortal a

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: purpose as then each bore, upon importance of so

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: slight and trivial a nature.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: By your pardon, sir, I was then a young traveller;

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: rather shunned to go even with what I heard than in

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: my every action to be guided by others' experiences:

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: but upon my mended judgment--if I offend not to say

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: it is mended--my quarrel was not altogether slight.

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: 'Faith, yes, to be put to the arbitrement of swords,

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: and by such two that would by all likelihood have

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: confounded one the other, or have fallen both.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Can we, with manners, ask what was the difference?

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: Safely, I think: 'twas a contention in public,

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: which may, without contradiction, suffer the report.

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: It was much like an argument that fell out last

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: night, where each of us fell in praise of our

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: country mistresses; this gentleman at that time

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: vouching--and upon warrant of bloody

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: affirmation--his to be more fair, virtuous, wise,

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: chaste, constant-qualified and less attemptable

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: than any the rarest of our ladies in France.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That lady is not now living, or this gentleman's

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: opinion by this worn out.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: She holds her virtue still and I my mind.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: You must not so far prefer her 'fore ours of Italy.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Being so far provoked as I was in France, I would

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: abate her nothing, though I profess myself her

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: adorer, not her friend.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: As fair and as good--a kind of hand-in-hand

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: comparison--had been something too fair and too good

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: for any lady in Britain. If she went before others

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I have seen, as that diamond of yours outlustres

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: many I have beheld. I could not but believe she

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: excelled many: but I have not seen the most

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: precious diamond that is, nor you the lady.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I praised her as I rated her: so do I my stone.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: What do you esteem it at?

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: More than the world enjoys.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Either your unparagoned mistress is dead, or she's

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: outprized by a trifle.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: You are mistaken: the one may be sold, or given, if

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: there were wealth enough for the purchase, or merit

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: for the gift: the other is not a thing for sale,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: and only the gift of the gods.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Which the gods have given you?

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Which, by their graces, I will keep.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: You may wear her in title yours: but, you know,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: strange fowl light upon neighbouring ponds. Your

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: ring may be stolen too: so your brace of unprizable

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: estimations; the one is but frail and the other

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: casual; a cunning thief, or a that way accomplished

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: courtier, would hazard the winning both of first and last.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Your Italy contains none so accomplished a courtier

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: to convince the honour of my mistress, if, in the

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: holding or loss of that, you term her frail. I do

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: nothing doubt you have store of thieves;

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: notwithstanding, I fear not my ring.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Let us leave here, gentlemen.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Sir, with all my heart. This worthy signior, I

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: thank him, makes no stranger of me; we are familiar at first.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: With five times so much conversation, I should get

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: ground of your fair mistress, make her go back, even

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: to the yielding, had I admittance and opportunity to friend.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: No, no.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I dare thereupon pawn the moiety of my estate to

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: your ring; which, in my opinion, o'ervalues it

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: something: but I make my wager rather against your

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: confidence than her reputation: and, to bar your

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: offence herein too, I durst attempt it against any

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: lady in the world.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: You are a great deal abused in too bold a

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: persuasion; and I doubt not you sustain what you're

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: worthy of by your attempt.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: What's that?

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: A repulse: though your attempt, as you call it,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: deserve more; a punishment too.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Gentlemen, enough of this: it came in too suddenly;

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: let it die as it was born, and, I pray you, be

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: better acquainted.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Would I had put my estate and my neighbour's on the

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: approbation of what I have spoke!

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: What lady would you choose to assail?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Yours; whom in constancy you think stands so safe.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I will lay you ten thousand ducats to your ring,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: that, commend me to the court where your lady is,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: with no more advantage than the opportunity of a

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: second conference, and I will bring from thence

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: that honour of hers which you imagine so reserved.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I will wage against your gold, gold to it: my ring

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I hold dear as my finger; 'tis part of it.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: You are afraid, and therein the wiser. If you buy

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: ladies' flesh at a million a dram, you cannot

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: preserve it from tainting: but I see you have some

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: religion in you, that you fear.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: This is but a custom in your tongue; you bear a

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: graver purpose, I hope.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I am the master of my speeches, and would undergo

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: what's spoken, I swear.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Will you? I shall but lend my diamond till your

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: return: let there be covenants drawn between's: my

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: mistress exceeds in goodness the hugeness of your

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: unworthy thinking: I dare you to this match: here's my ring.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: I will have it no lay.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: By the gods, it is one. If I bring you no

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: sufficient testimony that I have enjoyed the dearest

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: bodily part of your mistress, my ten thousand ducats

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: are yours; so is your diamond too: if I come off,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: and leave her in such honour as you have trust in,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: she your jewel, this your jewel, and my gold are

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: yours: provided I have your commendation for my more

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: free entertainment.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I embrace these conditions; let us have articles

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: betwixt us. Only, thus far you shall answer: if

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: you make your voyage upon her and give me directly

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: to understand you have prevailed, I am no further

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: your enemy; she is not worth our debate: if she

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: remain unseduced, you not making it appear

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: otherwise, for your ill opinion and the assault you

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: have made to her chastity you shall answer me with

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: your sword.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Your hand; a covenant: we will have these things set

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: down by lawful counsel, and straight away for

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Britain, lest the bargain should catch cold and

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: starve: I will fetch my gold and have our two

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: wagers recorded.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Agreed.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Exeunt POSTHUMUS LEONATUS and IACHIMO

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: Will this hold, think you?

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Signior Iachimo will not from it.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Pray, let us follow 'em.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Exeunt
